grimoire.prelude: Jmorvi Shek-Pvar, standing between fire and earth, have an affinity for all minerals, but especially metals. Their element is the solid heart of the world, steel and black iron. Most Jmorvi are artificers; their magic tends to run in a slower vein than that of other Shek-Pvar. The element and its manipulators are powerful and unyielding, but sometimes brittle, insensitive, brutal and shallow. Jmorvi distrust the spiritual believing the soul of humanity to be unpredictable and unreliable. They prefer the sureness and solidity of cold, hard steel.

spell.name: Sight of Eneldir
spell.description: A spell to detect and identify metallic minerals. The caster declares a specific metallic mineral and learns the direction to the nearest (single) 'good source'. A small amount of refined metal in close proximity is more noticeable than a large deposit of ore a hundred metres away. Although the spell ignores any Focus through which it is cast, it may detect a companion's sword.

spell.name: Ward of Sirik
spell.description: An enchantment to temporarily protect a wholly metallic object from physical damage. The enchantment lies dormant until it is invoked. The Ward is invoked by the first event which could cause damage to the object. Once invoked, the enchantment is dispelled (even if the duration is concentration). It doubles the soak of the object.

spell.name: Aspect of Tarus
spell.description: An enchantment which transforms the surface of a wholly metallic object into another metal. The enchantment is fragile, and, because it only places an extremely thin veneer, transformed objects will not pass more than a cursory inspection. Scratching the object, even with a fingernail, removes some of the plating. The transformation must be to a lower density metal. The maximum weight of the object is 100kg.

spell.name: Tempering of Pytama
spell.description: An enchantment to increase the weapon quality of a wholly metallic weapon. With success, one statistic (initiative, attack, defence or damage) is increased by 1. This is not cumulative with any other weapon enhancing magic, including rune magic.

spell.name: Sirik's Cant
spell.boost: +20 Can be laid on mostly metallic object
+40 Object can be made to shatter
spell.description: An enchantment which causes a wholly metallic object to resonate and grow warmer. Thismakes the object difficult to use and justifies an immediate penalty of at least 10. The object cannot weight more than 5kg.

spell.name: Anvil of Pytama
spell.boost: +20 Can affect a mostly metallic object
spell.description: A minor artifact power installed in a wholly metallic weapon to increase its damage. It cannot be combined with any other enchantment. The weapon does +2 damage.

spell.name: Fist of Kuhan
spell.description: An enchantment which infuses the caster's hands with Jmorvi essence, allowing them to strike for real damage. The limbs stiffen only when actually hitting or parrying, so there is no loss of flexibility.

spell.name: Forge of Obras
spell.boost: +50 Can change into a denser metal
spell.description: An enchantment to change up to 10kg of metal into a different metal which is less dense.

spell.name: Tharasin's Ward
spell.description: An enchantment to increase the soak of wholly metallic armour. The soak of such armour is increased by 1. This cannot be combined with another similar enchantment, including rune magic.

spell.name: Barl's Cloak
spell.description: An enchantment which toughens the skin to protect like armour. The skin assumes a slight blue-black colour while the enchantment is in place. The caster's soak is increased by 3.
